metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2389 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.34 and prior and8.0.25 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticatedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-router - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.26-0ubuntu1').
